document.docAuthor: Zatwarnicki, Tadeusz, Cielniak, Magdalena & Pochrząst, Katarzyna
document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the Old World species of Leptopsilopa Cresson (Insecta: Diptera: Ephydridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the Old World species of Leptopsilopa Cresson (Insecta: Diptera: Ephydridae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Psilopa irregularis Malloch, 1934 : 314
—synonymy by Cresson, 1936 : 53 .
Psilopa confentei Canzoneri and Munari, 1991 : 163
,
new synonym
.
Psilopa confenteae : Mathis and Zatwarnicki, 1995 : 40
[correction; name formed to honor a woman]

Description . Body length 1.58–1.81 mm . Head (
Fig. 9
A– 9 B). Antennae dark, basiflagellomere lighter in ventral half; arista with seven-nine dorsal rays; frons shining blue, with more golden reflection medially, frontal setae equal in length, slightly shorter than ocellar; face narrow, its width is equal to distance between antennae (facial ratio 0.11 ), wrinkled transversally and shiny medially, silvery microtomentose laterally; facial seta moderate, in lower 1 / 3 of face, parafacialia whitish microtomentose; palpus black; gena-to-eye ratio 0.05–0.08 .

Thorax. Mesonotum and scutellum black shiny, anepisternum and sides of mesonotum with golden reflection, remaining with black reflection; scutellum trapezoidal with rounded posterior margin, surface flat, bears a few short setulae; wing hyaline; costal vein ratio 0.87–1.18 ; M vein ratio 0.49–0.61 ; legs black, mid and hind tarsi yellowish, except dark distal segment; stem of halter brown, head white.

Abdomen black, metallic shiny with green and golden reflection. Male terminalia (
Figs. 8
A– 8 D). Epandrium in ventral view (
Fig. 8
A) U-shaped with dorsal arch slightly narrower than lateral arms; in lateral view (
Fig. 8
B) height almost
2 x
the greatest width, pouch-like; cercus in ventral view (
Fig. 8
A) uniformly oval; in lateral view (
Fig. 8
B) shallowly arched; pregonostylus well-developed, in ventral view (
Fig. 8
A) spatulate with bar-like, lateromedial basal projection bearing 4 long and 3 much smaller setulae; in lateral view (
Fig. 8
B) C-shaped, with truncate base and rounded apex, ventral margin almost straight, dorsal margin deeply concave, projection almost oval; postgonostylus in ventral view (
Figs. 8
C) elongate, inverted L-shaped, bearing setulae on apical half; in lateral view (
Figs. 8
D) finger-like and slightly arcuate; medandrium (= subepandrial plate) (
Figs. 8
C– 8 D) bandlike, arch-like; aedeagus in ventral view (
Figs. 8
C) broadly elliptical, tapered gradually to apex, small indentation on 2 / 3 length; in lateral view (
Figs. 8
D) elongate, funnel-like, wider basally, tapered to rounded apex; gonite bears three well developed setae, in ventral view (
Fig. 8
C) spatulate with sinuous lateral margin; in lateral view (
Figs. 8
D) narrowly ovate; phallapodeme in ventral view (
Fig. 8
C) goblet-shaped; in lateral view (
Figs. 8
D) lunate with small subrectangular keel apically; hypandrium in ventral view (
Figs. 8
C) trapezoidal, with convex posterior margin; in lateral view (
Fig. 8
D) subtriangular, narrowing toward phallapodeme.

Type material examined.
Lectotype female of senior synonym, herein designated, labelled: " Singapore Biró 1898 ", " Ephygrobia pollinosa Kert. det Kertesz typus " (red), " typus " (with red margin) in good condition and a paralectotype female in good condition, labelled: " Singapore Biró 1898 ", " Ephygrobia pollinosa Kert. " "det Kertesz typus " (red), " typus " (with red margin) preserved in HNHM; paratype female of Malloch's species in moderate condition (abdomen flattened laterally and left wing missing) labelled “Para- type ” (round label with yellow margin), “W. M. Gifford Collection” (red printed letters), “Pres. by P. A. Buxton B. M.
1934 - 97
”, “
Psilopa irregularis Malloch Paratype
” (handwritten), “H. C. Kellers Coll.
IV- 18
” (
IV- 18
handwritten), “ 760–900 ft . Tutuna Samoa ” (numbers handwritten) preserved in BMNH; holotype of
L. confentae
labelled: " NEPAL Bagmati River near Kathmandu 1300 m ,
4 . VI 1980
A.M.CONFENTE L.GARIGGIO legit" (with black margin), " HOLOTYPUS Psilopa confentei ♂ sp. nov. S. Canzoneri - L. Munari" (red with black margin, handwritten, after HOLOTYPUS black line), "MUSEO CIVICO DI STORIA NATURALE DI VENEZIA Materiale tipico descritto Inv. n. 02933" (orange, number handwritten) and a paratype male with the same locality label preserved in MCSNV.

Other material examined : AMERICAN SAMOA : Pago Pago, Tutulla,

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 8. Structures of the male terminalia of
Leptopsilopa pollinosa
(Kertész)
(Sri Lanka: Maskellya Oya). A, Epandrium, cerci, and pregonostyli, ventral view. B, Same, lateral view. C, Internal genitalic structures (aedeagus (shaded), phallapodeme, medandrium, postgonostylus, gonite, and hypandrium), ventral view. D, Same, lateral view. Scale bar 0.1 mm.

FIGURE 9. Head of
Leptopsilopa pollinosa
(Kertész)
. A. Anterior view. B. Oblique view.

FIGURE 10. Distribution map for
Leptopsilopa mutabilis
Cresson
(circles) and
L. pollinosa
(Kertész)
(hatched area).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks . Externally this species is very similar to
L. africana
but is distinguished from this species by the black basiflagellomere and palpus.
